text.section: In this subtitle, "construction or improvement" means the planning, design, engineering, alteration, construction, reconstruction, enlargement, expansion, extension, improvement, replacement, rehabilitation, renovation, upgrading, repair, or capital equipping.

A county may issue bonds to finance any or all of the costs of construction or improvement of public schools in the county provided that the construction and improvement contracts and subcontracts comply with the requirements of Title 17, Subtitle 2 and Title 14 of the State Finance and Procurement Article if the requirements would otherwise be applicable.

section.section: Bonds shall be authorized by a resolution of the governing body of the county.

text.section:
The county may enter into agreements with agents, banks, fiduciaries, insurers, or others to:
Enhance the marketability of and security for the bonds; or
Secure any tender option granted to the holders of the bonds.
If any officer whose signature appears on a bond ceases to be an officer before delivery of the bonds, the signature is valid and sufficient for all purposes.
The bonds, their issue, and their sale may be exempt from the provisions of Sections 9, 10, and 11 of Article 31 of the Code.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, the net proceeds of the sale of the bonds may only be applied to the construction or improvement of public school facilities, as described in the resolution authorizing the issuance of the bonds.

text.section: Bonds issued under this subtitle are negotiable instruments under the laws of this State.
Before the preparation of bonds, the county may issue bond anticipation notes in accordance with Article 31, § 12 of the Code.
